org.jmisb.api.klv.st1303

Class ElementProcessedEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmisb.api.klv.st1303.ElementProcessedEncoder

  • public class ElementProcessedEncoder
extends Object
    MISB ST 1201 Element Processing Encoder.

    In formatting floating point Elements into KLV, MISB ST 1201 reduces the number of bytes per Element by mapping floating point values to integers. There are two methods specified in ST 1201 for mapping the values: IMAPA and IMAPB. IMAPA parameters include minimum, maximum and a precision values to compute the length of a mapped integer value; IMAPB parameters include minimum, maximum and a pre-computed length value.

    The value of EBytes along with the Minimum and Maximum values form the IMAPB mapping parameters for each value in the Array: IMAPB(Minimum, Maximum, EBytes). Because the MDAP already specifies the length of an Element in the Array, ST 1303 uses the IMAPB method of MISB ST 1201.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElementProcessedEncoder

        public ElementProcessedEncoder(double min,
                               double max,
                               int ebytes)
        Constructor.

        The encoder is set up with the standard IMAPB parameters, which cannot be changed. Create a new instance if the parameters need to change.

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value for the encoding (same as a parameter in IMAPB).
        max - the maximum value for the encoding (same as b parameter in IMAPB).
        ebytes - the number of bytes to encode to (same as L parameter in IMAPB).

      • ElementProcessedEncoder

        public ElementProcessedEncoder(double min,
                               double max,
                               double resolution)
        Constructor.

        The encoder is set up with the standard IMAPA parameters, which cannot be changed. Create a new instance if the parameters need to change.

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value for the encoding (same as a parameter in IMAPA).
        max - the maximum value for the encoding (same as b parameter in IMAPA).
        resolution - the resolution to encode to (same as g parameter in IMAPA).

      • ElementProcessedEncoder

        public ElementProcessedEncoder(float min,
                               float max,
                               int ebytes)
        Constructor.

        The encoder is set up with the standard IMAPB parameters, which cannot be changed. Create a new instance if the parameters need to change.

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value for the encoding (same as a parameter in IMAPB).
        max - the maximum value for the encoding (same as b parameter in IMAPB).
        ebytes - the number of bytes to encode to (same as L parameter in IMAPB).

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(double[] data)
              throws KlvParseException
        Encode a one dimensional double array to a Multi-Dimensional Array Pack using ST1201 Element Processed Encoding.

        This encodes each value into a ST1201 IMAPB encoded element, and serialises the 1D data matrix to a byte array.

        Parameters:
        data - the array of floating point (double) values.
        Returns:
        the encoded byte array including the MISB ST1303 header and array data.
        Throws:
        KlvParseException - if the encoding fails, such as for invalid array dimensions.

      • encode
